1 var _ = require('underscore');
  2 
  3 /*global navigator: false */
  4 module.exports = function(AV) {
  5   /**
  6    * Creates a new GeoPoint with any of the following forms:<br>
  7    *   <pre>
  8    *   new GeoPoint(otherGeoPoint)
  9    *   new GeoPoint(30, 30)
 10    *   new GeoPoint([30, 30])
 11    *   new GeoPoint({latitude: 30, longitude: 30})
 12    *   new GeoPoint()  // defaults to (0, 0)
 13    *   </pre>
 14    * @class
 15    *
 16    * <p>Represents a latitude / longitude point that may be associated
 17    * with a key in a AVObject or used as a reference point for geo queries.
 18    * This allows proximity-based queries on the key.</p>
 19    *
 20    * <p>Only one key in a class may contain a GeoPoint.</p>
 21    *
 22    * <p>Example:<pre>
 23    *   var point = new AV.GeoPoint(30.0, -20.0);
 24    *   var object = new AV.Object("PlaceObject");
 25    *   object.set("location", point);
 26    *   object.save();</pre></p>
 27    */
 28   AV.GeoPoint = function(arg1, arg2) {
 29     if (_.isArray(arg1)) {
 30       AV.GeoPoint._validate(arg1[0], arg1[1]);
 31       this.latitude = arg1[0];
 32       this.longitude = arg1[1];
 33     } else if (_.isObject(arg1)) {
 34       AV.GeoPoint._validate(arg1.latitude, arg1.longitude);
 35       this.latitude = arg1.latitude;
 36       this.longitude = arg1.longitude;
 37     } else if (_.isNumber(arg1) && _.isNumber(arg2)) {
 38       AV.GeoPoint._validate(arg1, arg2);
 39       this.latitude = arg1;
 40       this.longitude = arg2;
 41     } else {
 42       this.latitude = 0;
 43       this.longitude = 0;
 44     }
 45 
 46     // Add properties so that anyone using Webkit or Mozilla will get an error
 47     // if they try to set values that are out of bounds.
 48     var self = this;
 49     if (this.__defineGetter__ && this.__defineSetter__) {
 50       // Use _latitude and _longitude to actually store the values, and add
 51       // getters and setters for latitude and longitude.
 52       this._latitude = this.latitude;
 53       this._longitude = this.longitude;
 54       this.__defineGetter__("latitude", function() {
 55         return self._latitude;
 56       });
 57       this.__defineGetter__("longitude", function() {
 58         return self._longitude;
 59       });
 60       this.__defineSetter__("latitude", function(val) {
 61         AV.GeoPoint._validate(val, self.longitude);
 62         self._latitude = val;
 63       });
 64       this.__defineSetter__("longitude", function(val) {
 65         AV.GeoPoint._validate(self.latitude, val);
 66         self._longitude = val;
 67       });
 68     }
 69   };
 70 
 71   /**
 72    * @lends AV.GeoPoint.prototype
 73    * @property {float} latitude North-south portion of the coordinate, in range
 74    *   [-90, 90].  Throws an exception if set out of range in a modern browser.
 75    * @property {float} longitude East-west portion of the coordinate, in range
 76    *   [-180, 180].  Throws if set out of range in a modern browser.
 77    */
 78 
 79   /**
 80    * Throws an exception if the given lat-long is out of bounds.
 81    */
 82   AV.GeoPoint._validate = function(latitude, longitude) {
 83     if (latitude < -90.0) {
 84       throw "AV.GeoPoint latitude " + latitude + " < -90.0.";
 85     }
 86     if (latitude > 90.0) {
 87       throw "AV.GeoPoint latitude " + latitude + " > 90.0.";
 88     }
 89     if (longitude < -180.0) {
 90       throw "AV.GeoPoint longitude " + longitude + " < -180.0.";
 91     }
 92     if (longitude > 180.0) {
 93       throw "AV.GeoPoint longitude " + longitude + " > 180.0.";
 94     }
 95   };
 96 
 97   /**
 98    * Creates a GeoPoint with the user's current location, if available.
 99    * Calls options.success with a new GeoPoint instance or calls options.error.
100    * @param {Object} options An object with success and error callbacks.
101    */
102   AV.GeoPoint.current = function(options) {
103     var promise = new AV.Promise();
104     navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(function(location) {
105       promise.resolve(new AV.GeoPoint({
106         latitude: location.coords.latitude,
107         longitude: location.coords.longitude
108       }));
109 
110     }, function(error) {
111       promise.reject(error);
112     });
113 
114     return promise._thenRunCallbacks(options);
115   };
116 
117   AV.GeoPoint.prototype = {
118     /**
119      * Returns a JSON representation of the GeoPoint, suitable for AV.
120      * @return {Object}
121      */
122     toJSON: function() {
123       AV.GeoPoint._validate(this.latitude, this.longitude);
124       return {
125         "__type": "GeoPoint",
126         latitude: this.latitude,
127         longitude: this.longitude
128       };
129     },
130 
131     /**
132      * Returns the distance from this GeoPoint to another in radians.
133      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point the other AV.GeoPoint.
134      * @return {Number}
135      */
136     radiansTo: function(point) {
137       var d2r = Math.PI / 180.0;
138       var lat1rad = this.latitude * d2r;
139       var long1rad = this.longitude * d2r;
140       var lat2rad = point.latitude * d2r;
141       var long2rad = point.longitude * d2r;
142       var deltaLat = lat1rad - lat2rad;
143       var deltaLong = long1rad - long2rad;
144       var sinDeltaLatDiv2 = Math.sin(deltaLat / 2);
145       var sinDeltaLongDiv2 = Math.sin(deltaLong / 2);
146       // Square of half the straight line chord distance between both points.
147       var a = ((sinDeltaLatDiv2 * sinDeltaLatDiv2) +
148                (Math.cos(lat1rad) * Math.cos(lat2rad) *
149                 sinDeltaLongDiv2 * sinDeltaLongDiv2));
150       a = Math.min(1.0, a);
151       return 2 * Math.asin(Math.sqrt(a));
152     },
153 
154     /**
155      * Returns the distance from this GeoPoint to another in kilometers.
156      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point the other AV.GeoPoint.
157      * @return {Number}
158      */
159     kilometersTo: function(point) {
160       return this.radiansTo(point) * 6371.0;
161     },
162 
163     /**
164      * Returns the distance from this GeoPoint to another in miles.
165      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point the other AV.GeoPoint.
166      * @return {Number}
167      */
168     milesTo: function(point) {
169       return this.radiansTo(point) * 3958.8;
170     }
171   };
172 };
173
